intro: Aletris luteoviridis, commonly known as the yellow-green wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its rosette growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring, typically in clusters at the tips of the stems. Aletris luteoviridis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
